secret_rule: Pairs of items can be brought to the picnic if they are both symbolic representations found in the same well-known piece of visual art (paintings, sculptures, etc.).

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "starry night" and "cypress tree".
I would like to make a new guess: Can I bring "whispering brook"?
I would like to make a new guess: Can I bring "sunny sky"?
I would like to make a new guess: Can I bring "dreamy aurora"?
I would like to make a new guess: Can I bring "midnight forest"?

Based on the examples provided by the game master and the rejected guesses, it seems that the rule might focus on words that both contain the letter "r" in the same position of each word or some other letter pattern present in both words. In "starry night" and "cypress tree," you can notice that both words in these phrases contain the letter "r". 

For my best guess, the rule could be: The items you can bring must have two words, and each word must contain the letter "r".
